title: Not all champs need a rework, some champs just need a visual update....
body:
Remember when they updated the old twitch model? That's what I'm talking about. A lot of champs kits are perfectly fine, but their base models are horrible.

Example

{{champion:96}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:35}} 


{{champion:82}} Have you seen the size of his feet?
{{champion:24}} walking eggplant!
{{champion:6}} He really needs some help in every category. 

These champs could really use a full visual update. The don't really need a rework, just an visual update. It's also in riot best interest to make the game look polished because looking at this {{champion:6}} as a potential new player might just make you walk the other way.

replies.body: #updatepizzafeetS7

You forgot {{champion:77}} 

The only reason people forget about his ugly ass classic skin is because any udyr player who has an ounce of shame buys spirit guard. Spirit guard is so popular on udyr that it has basically become his classic skin.
I think they should do this, give him the spirit guard udyr as classic skin and replace the skin itself or refund all buyers. Would be cool (and the only way to save udyr's visual).
Refunds and Riot don't go together in a sentence.
Unless the words " doesn't give " are between them.
or Definitely Not Udyr

Uhh...Mundo definitely needs a rework. In fact some champions you've mentioned are not fine kit wise. 

Mordekaiser is obvious. Mundo's only niche is regeneration and ends up breaking good tank stuff because it makes him unkillable and allow him to hit hard. Pantheon is a very simple and very oppressive lane bully who can't do much late beyond being a stun bot. Galio is getting a rework because his kit doesn't really flow naturally. Etc. 

Besides, visual updates are just extra work for champions that have glaring issues that will have to be addressed eventually. It's more productive to just give full VU in heavy gameplay reworks.
I still think Galios kit is fun and unique, I do agree about panth though I win a lot of lane matchups because he is just broke.
yeh, i like galios kit, allthough i do with it *flew* together a bit smoother

Mundo is a mad scientist who doped himself to be buff but for some reason has fireballs...how does that fit in thematically? Yeah I agree he needs some kind of update, but he isn't a high priority to be honest. If Riot went along changing everything that needed to be fixed then we would have attention removed from bigger issues and new content.

Actually, I for one wouldn't mind if they just quit adding new champs for a while and put their whole champ design team on reworks.  The roster is growing too fast for the game to actually ever be balanced to any reasonable extent.
Riot has said that their purely visual updates were much less well received than their full VGUs, so they will only be doing the whole package from now on.
